intro: Cleistanthus insularis, commonly known as the island cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is typically found in lowland to montane forest areas. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and elliptical, dark green leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
